sense.def:
The name of a person, thing, or place
je beseda ali sklop besed, s katerimi opredelimo ali prepoznamo človeka, predmet ali kraj.

Kadar človek
names someone or something
, nekomu ali nečemu dá ime.

seg.quote: She wanted to name the baby Colleen.

sense.def:
To name someone or something
pomeni tudi, da nekoga ali nekaj identificiramo z imenom.

seg.quote: ...a Minister, whom he did not name.
...various flowers: roses, tulips and snapdragons, to name only a few.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
names someone or something after a person or thing
, tej osebi ali stvari da ime po neki drugi osebi ali stvari.

seg.quote: The College in Holborn is named after her.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
names something
, na primer datum za sestanek ali ceno nečesa, pove, kdaj naj bi bil sestanek oziroma kolikšna naj bi bila cena.

seg.quote: He named a price he thought would scare me off.

sense.def:
Izraz
name
lahko uporabimo tudi za človekov sloves.

seg.quote: Grey spoke out in public to clear Haldane's name.
They were giving the country a bad name.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekdo
a name
, je slaven.

Kadar nekoga omenimo
by name
, o njem ne govorimo posredno, pač pa povemo njegovo ime.

Kadar človek
calls someone names
, za nekoga uporablja neprijazne ali žaljive besede, ki tistega človeka razjezijo ali užalijo.

Kadar je nekaj prijavljeno
in one's name
, uradno pripada tisti osebi ali je rezervirano zanjo.

seg.quote: The room was reserved in the name of Peters.

sense.def:
Kdor nekaj naredi
in the name of an ideal or a group of people
, to naredi zato, ker verjame v ideal ali ker predstavlja skupino.

seg.quote: The group claims to speak in the name of ‘the simple people of the country’.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
makes a name for himself
, postane znan ali občudovan zaradi nečesa, kar je naredil.

seg.quote: George Eliot had already made a name for herself as a writer.
